security_audit.summary: This skill executes shell commands to run lint, test, and build processes. While it has legitimate QA purposes, it requires command execution capabilities which could be misused if the underlying commands are compromised.

medium_findings.title: Command execution in QA checks
medium_findings.description: The skill executes multiple shell commands including './gradlew check', 'pnpm run lint:all', and 'pnpm run build'. While these are legitimate QA tools, command execution always carries risk if the underlying tools or their configurations are compromised.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded project path
low_findings.description: The skill references a hardcoded project path '/Users/koujienami/CursorProjects/YouTubeOpsAI' which suggests it may be tightly coupled to a specific development environment.

content.user_title: Automate QA checks before PR creation
content.value_statement: Manual quality checks are time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically runs lint, tests, builds, and coverage verification to ensure code meets quality standards before PR creation.
actual_capabilities: Validates successful builds for both frontend and backend
Generates comprehensive QA reports with pass/fail status
limitations: Fixed coverage thresholds (80% overall, 90% business logic)

use_cases.title: Pre-PR quality validation
use_cases.description: Automatically verify code quality, test coverage, and build success before creating pull requests

use_cases.title: CI/CD pipeline validation
use_cases.description: Ensure local development meets the same quality standards as automated CI/CD pipelines

use_cases.title: Code review preparation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive quality reports to facilitate efficient code review processes

prompt_templates.title: Basic QA check
prompt_templates.scenario: Run standard checks on both frontend and backend

prompt_templates.title: Backend quick check
prompt_templates.scenario: Skip coverage for faster backend validation

prompt_templates.title: Full validation report
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate detailed quality report with all checks

output_examples.input: Run QA checks before creating a PR
output: Frontend: Lint clean, tests passing, build successful
Overall Status: PASSED - Ready for PR creation

best_practices: Always run QA checks before creating pull requests to catch issues early
Fix all critical lint errors and ensure tests pass before requesting reviews
Maintain coverage above 90% for business logic to ensure code reliability
anti_patterns: Skipping coverage checks to hide low test coverage
Ignoring lint warnings which may indicate code quality issues
Running checks only on one part of the stack when changes affect both

faq.question: What coverage thresholds does this skill enforce?
faq.answer: The skill requires 80% overall coverage and 90% for business logic (Service layer). Frontend requires 75% for logic and 45% for UI.

faq.question: Can I run checks on just frontend or backend?
faq.answer: Yes, use target="frontend" or target="backend" to check only one part of your stack. Default checks both.

faq.question: What happens if checks fail?
faq.answer: The skill reports specific failures with error details. Fix the issues and rerun. The PR should not be created until all checks pass.

faq.question: Is my code data safe during checks?
faq.answer: The skill only runs standard lint and test commands. It doesn't modify code or send data externally. All processing happens locally.

faq.question: How do I interpret the coverage report?
faq.answer: The report shows percentage coverage. Aim for green (90%+) on business logic. Yellow (80-89%) is acceptable but should be improved.

faq.question: Can this replace my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: No, this complements CI/CD by catching issues early. Always ensure your pipeline also runs these checks before merging.
